result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony B. Staten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tony B. Staten is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tony B. Staten was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:45 14CF120, 14CF179, 14CT116 also at this time. Defendant Tony B. Staten in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Defendant Tony B. Staten in custody.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSIs filed, Sticht addresses recommendations in PSI. Atty Harrelson addresses changes to PSI --<court breaks 11:51><court resumes 11:58> Sticht goes along w/recommendation in PSI except on 14CF179, recommends 90 days cond. jail imposed and stayed, guidelines for 14CT116 test .141. Atty Harrelson: guidelines on 14CT116, 14CF102 4 years probabtion w/9 mo cond. jail to be executed, huber for work and treatment, concrruent probation 3 years on 14CF179 and 14CF120. Atty Harrelson provides court with waiver of extradition from Goodhue County, 2 letters from PCSO, 103 days credit on CT case, 14CF102 145 days credit, 14CF179 119 days credit, 14CF120 141 days. Sticht agrees with credit. Defendant addresses the court. Court addresses the defendant. 
Court orders 14CT116:
Time served--103 days, $1694.00 fine, 24 month revocation of DL, complete alcohol assessment and driver safety plan, IID for a period of 2 years to any vehicle owned, operated, registered to defendant, $50 IID surchage and DNA Sample surcharge is included in fine.
Court orders 14CF102:
S/W 4 years, 1 year in pierce co jail w/work release privelages for work and treatment, follow conditions set forth by Agent, no poss. or conumption of alcohol, or illegal drugs, only possess/consume prescriptions in amount prescribed, complete alcohol assessment and follow recommended treatment, def. subject to random alcohol and drug testing. Defendant to be hooked up for home monitoring on January 25th, 2018. Release January 9th, 2019. Court costs $515 due during probation, $400 restitution read in from 15CF95 to be paid as a condition of this probation. Sentence credit if revoked is 145 days.
Court orders 14CF120 and 14CF179:
S/W 4 years on each case all concurrent and concurrent to probation on 14CF102, 14CF120 141 days sentence credit if revoked, 14CF179 119 days credit if revoked, same conditions as conditions in 14CF102, except no conditional jail, court costs of $515 on each case. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 12:48
